text: Directorate General of Drug Administration (DGDA) is the principle drug regulatory agency in Bangladesh and it functions under the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. ==History== Directorate General of Drug Administration was established in 1976 under the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare as a separate department. It was upgraded on 17 January 2010. The department is responsible for issuing licenses to pharmaceutical companies. The Drug Control Committee of the department decides on drug registration. ==References== Category:Government agencies of Bangladesh Category:1976 establishments in Bangladesh Category:Organisations based in Dhaka Category:Drugs in Bangladesh
